description.narrative: The project Ensuring Gender Justice, Rights and Good Governance aims to create a discrimination free equitable society by enhancing knowledge on GAD among the mass people with the special focus on RHs which leads to reducing gender discrimination among male and female and motivate the Union Parishad leaders to create opportunity for women. The project also keen to aware mass people and initiate protection and behavioral change on HIV/AIDS and SRHR. The core problem is that the Northern women’s lives are dominated by the customary social system, which by definition is patriarchal, patrilineal and patrilocal. There is a lack of consciousness about women’s rights, particularly amongst the poorer levels of society, and the many social and cultural barriers mean their rights are not accessed. The overall goal of the project is to ensure gender justice rights & good governance with the following major results 1) positive change of gender, rights & good governance status of 15, 000 male & female (60% female & 40% male); 2) any forms of VAW are reduced by at least 40%; 3) more than 50% youth & other RHs aware on human rights and they are playing active role and more than 25% women leadership qualities enhance through participating in democratization process compared to base year 2015.  Major activities: Formation and strengthen of CBOs like GAD Forum, gender watch group, student group, youth forum, civil society forum, women forum, professional forum, training on gender, RTI, leadership, disaster management, human rights and women rights, SRHR with different forums and groups, drama and video show, celebration of special days , bicycle rally, monthly meetings at each formed groups. The project is being implemented in 364 villages of 48 Unions in 9 Upazila of Thakurgaon, Panchagarh, Dinajpur and Rangpur, Rajshahi districts with around 18,000 direct RHs (11,000 women).
This project mainly contributes to results within Combating gender based violence. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
